title: 115_hr3077
content: The Act titled "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to Section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals certain subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to Section 203, including changes to subsections (c), (d), and (e). Additionally, there are additional conforming amendments related to benefits terminated upon deportation in Section 202(n)(1) of the Social Security Act. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" makes amendments to Section 202(n)(1) of the Social Security Act, specifically regarding benefits terminated upon deportation. Amendments include changes to subsections (c), (d), and (e) of Section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends Section 202(s) of the Social Security Act, focusing on exemptions from reductions based on disregarding entitlements to child's insurance benefits. Amendments include changes to deductions under section 203 and 222(b). Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to sections 202(s), 202(t)(7), and 203(a)(3)(B)(iii) regarding benefits and suspensions for aliens. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to sections 202(t)(7), 203(a)(3)(B)(iii), and 208(a)(1)(C) related to benefits, reductions, and penalties for misrepresentations. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to sections 208(a)(1)(C) and 215(b)(2)(A) regarding deductions from benefits on account of work and earnings in benefit computation years. Amendments to the Social Security Act involve changes to sections 215(b)(2)(A) and 215(g) regarding earnings and benefits computation. Section 215(b)(2)(A) is amended to specify no wages or net earnings from self-employment in the year. Section 215(g) is amended to remove deductions under section 203(b). Section 1612(a) is also amended to define income for SSI purposes. Section 1612(a) of the Social Security Act is amended to define the term 'wages' for SSI purposes, excluding certain limitations on remuneration amounts. This definition includes services performed within the United States as an employee or in the active military or naval services outside the country. The computation of wages under section 209(a) includes services performed within the United States or in the military services, with exclusions for certain payments made to employees or their dependents for retirement. Any payment made to an employee or their dependents for retirement, or any payment by an employer to an employee upon termination of employment due to retirement after reaching a specified age in a plan or pension plan. Repeal of deductions on account of work under the Railroad Retirement Program, with amendments to the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove subsections (f) and (g)(2), redesignating subsection (g)(1) as subsection (g). Conforming amendments are made to sections 3(f)(1) and 4(g)(2) of the Act. Section 4(g)(2) of the Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove certain clauses and the effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2018.
